New Records: Jasson Domínguez became the youngest Yankees player to homer in his first career game at 20 years, 206 days old.
Jasson Domínguez was the first Yankees player to hit a home run in his initial big league at-bat since Aaron Judge on Aug. 13, 2016.
Key Match Events: Jasson Domínguez hit a two-run homer off Houston ace Justin Verlander in his first major league at-bat.
Austin Wells singled off Justin Verlander in his first plate appearance.
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Boone recalled the poise and confidence Jasson Domínguez displayed as a 16-year-old during batting practice at the team's academy in the Dominican Republic.
Both Jasson Domínguez and Austin Wells were called up from the minors by the Yankees when rosters expanded.
Jasson Domínguez is expected to be the team's everyday center fielder after Harrison Bader was claimed off waivers by the Cincinnati Reds.
Austin Wells is expected to play a lot over the last month of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: Jasson Domínguez expressed excitement and happiness about his debut and hitting a home run.
Aaron Boone praised Domínguez's talent and potential, predicting he will be a really good player in the future.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jasson Domínguez had a bunch of friends and family members in Houston for the game, including his mother and father and some aunts and uncles.
